name: Couscous with Roast Chicken and Vegetables
instructions: In a medium saucepan, bring 1 cup of water to a boil. Add a pinch of salt and 1 cup of couscous. Stir, remove from heat, cover, and let sit for 5 minutes.
In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced courgettes and peppers, and sauté until tender, about 5-7 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs and milk. Pour over the sautéed vegetables and cook until just set, stirring gently.
Fluff the couscous with a fork and mix in the shredded roast chicken and the vegetable-egg mixture.
Season with salt, pepper, and chopped herbs. Serve warm.

name: Stuffed Peppers with Couscous and Chicken
instructions: Cook the couscous according to package instructions, using 1 cup of water.
In a bowl, combine cooked couscous, shredded roast chicken, grated courgettes, milk, and the beaten egg. Mix well and season with salt and pepper.
Stuff each half of the pepper with the couscous mixture and place in a baking dish.
Drizzle with olive oil and top with cheese if using.
Cover with foil and bake for 25-30 minutes until the peppers are tender. Remove the foil for the last 5 minutes to brown the cheese if added.
